intro: Xanthophyllum griffithii var. papillosum, commonly known as the Papillate Sunburst, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow bracts that resemble sunbursts. The plant features palmate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
